critique: The executive order is primarily concerned with national security and protecting the US bulk-power system from foreign adversaries. The main emotions the president likely wants to convey are fear (of potential attacks) and a sense of urgency and determination to address the threat. There might also be a subtle element of surprise at the vulnerability of the system. Joy and sadness are not relevant in this context. Disgust might be present towards the actions of foreign adversaries, but it's not a primary emotion to be conveyed.
